      • Serialized Fields

          javax.swing.ImageIcon ROCK_IMAGE
          Represents the Rock image.

        • PAPER_IMAGE

          javax.swing.ImageIcon PAPER_IMAGE
          Represents the Paper image.

        • SCISSORS_IMAGE

          javax.swing.ImageIcon SCISSORS_IMAGE
          Represents the Scissors image.

        • SOUND_ON

          javax.swing.ImageIcon SOUND_ON
          Represents the Sound enabled image.

        • SOUND_OFF

          javax.swing.ImageIcon SOUND_OFF
          Represents the Sound disabled image.

        • HEIGHT

          int HEIGHT
          Represents the Height of the Frame.

        • WIDTH

          int WIDTH
          Represents the Width of the Frame.

        • game

          Game game
          Used as the game logic for this Screen. Uses Game to play the actual game, allows us to trigger rounds on GameScreen.ChoiceListener

        • soundPlayer

          Sound soundPlayer
          Used as the sound player for any sound effects
          See Also:
          Sound}

        • outcomePane

          javax.swing.JPanel outcomePane
          Used as the JPanel that holds the users and enemies choices.

        • lblRockChoice

          javax.swing.JLabel lblRockChoice
          The label that represents the Rock choice.

        • lblPaperChoice

          javax.swing.JLabel lblPaperChoice
          The label that represents the Paper choice.

        • lblScissorsChoice

          javax.swing.JLabel lblScissorsChoice
          The label that represents the Scissors choice.

        • lblRound

          javax.swing.JLabel lblRound
          The label that represents the round the user is on.

        • lblEnemyScore

          javax.swing.JLabel lblEnemyScore
          The label that represents the amount of times the enemy has won.

        • lblUserScore

          javax.swing.JLabel lblUserScore
          The JLabel that represents the amount of times the user has won.

        • lblDraws

          javax.swing.JLabel lblDraws
          The JLabel that represents the amount of times a draw has occured.

        • lblSound

          javax.swing.JLabel lblSound
          The JLabel that represents if the sound is enabled or not.

        • choiceDisplayed

          boolean choiceDisplayed
          A value that indicates if the user has made a choice or not.

        • playSound

          boolean playSound
          Represents whether the screen should attempt to play sound.

          int ROUNDS_MAX

        • rdoRand

          javax.swing.JRadioButton rdoRand
          Represents the RandomAI option. Needs to be accessible for the MenuScreen.PlayListener.

        • rdoState

          javax.swing.JRadioButton rdoState
          Represents the StateAI option. Needs to be accessible for the MenuScreen.PlayListener.

        • rdoIntel

          javax.swing.JRadioButton rdoIntel
          Represents the IntelligentAI option. Needs to be accessible for the MenuScreen.PlayListener.

        • roundsSlider

          javax.swing.JSlider roundsSlider
          Represents the amount of rounds in Game. Needs to be accessible for the MenuScreen.PlayListener.
